modName: Unarmed scales with Light Armor perks
summary: Adds Unarmed perks to the light armor tree.
descriptionHtml:
Adds Extra effects to the Light Armor tree perks that improve your Unarmed combat. They\'re added to light armor because Unarmed doesn\'t improve a weapon skill, but your armor goes up while fighting, and Heavy Armor seemed too bulky to fight with your hands in.

The added effects are:

Each point into Agile Defender increases Unarmed damage by 20.
Custom Fit adds 10 points of stamina damage to Unarmed attacks.
Matching Set has a small chance to disarm opponents with power attacks.
Unhindered and Wind Walker each add 20 points of Unarmed damage.
Deft Movement gives power attacks a chance to paralyze enemies for a second.

There is a version of the file that require light armor equipped to gain the effects of the damage perks, and one without armor limitations.

Added a version that only adds effects to Custom Fit, Matching Set, and Deft Movements. This is so you can use a different Unarmed Scaling mod and still get my perk benefits.

In the curved scale version, the damage perks are:
Agile Defender: +10, +10, +10, +20, +30
Unhindered and Wind Walker have been increased to 30 each to keep the same max damage.

With all of the perks, this adds 140 damage, 10 stamina damage, and power attacks a chance to disarm or paralyze, making Unarmed just as viable as one or two handed.

I also added a \"Fists\" weapon that you can hotkey or add to favorites that shows your current Unarmed damage, accounting for perks, enchantments, and racial claw abilities. You MUST have the fists equipped to use the stamina damage, disarm, and paralyze perks, but the raw damage effects work for your normal fists too.

To get the fists, type \"help Fists 0\" into the console, and look for \"(WEAP)Fists 0x########\"
then type \"player.additem [##########] 1\". the fists are quest items, so you cant drop them. If you want to get rid of them, use \"player.removeitem [########]\".

Bugs:
Special effect perks (Stamina Damage, Disarm, and Paralyze) won\'t work with your actual fists, you have to have the Fists item equipped.
Special effect perks also only work when punching with your right fist, the damage perks affect both.
The disarm perk has a very low chance of triggering, despite setting it to go off 100% of the time.

If anyone knows how to fix any of these, leave a comment. Everyone else, have fun with your usable fists!
